title: Pasquale Padalino
text:
Pasquale Padalino (; born 26 July 1972) is an Italian <a href="association%20football">football</a> <a href="manager%20%28association%20football%29">manager</a> and a former <a href="Defender%20%28association%20football%29">central defender</a>, currently in charge as head coach of <a href="Serie%20C">Serie C</a> club <a href="A.C.N.%20Siena%201904">Siena</a>.
Playing career.
Club.
During his career, Padalino represented <a href="U.S.%20Foggia">U.S. Foggia</a>, <a href="Bologna%20F.C.%201909">Bologna F.C. 1909</a> (two stints), <a href="U.S.%20Lecce">U.S. Lecce</a>, <a href="ACF%20Fiorentina">ACF Fiorentina</a> (where he formed an interesting defensive partnership with <a href="Lorenzo%20Amoruso">Lorenzo Amoruso</a>, later of <a href="Rangers%20F.C.">Rangers F.C.</a>), <a href="Internazionale%20Milano%20F.C.">Inter Milan</a> (having only appeared once, in an <a href="Coppa%20Italia">Italian Cup</a> contest against <a href="Udinese%20Calcio">Udinese Calcio</a> where he got injured on his right knee, after a contrast with <a href="Roberto%20Muzzi">Roberto Muzzi</a> and missed out the rest of the season) and <a href="Como%20Calcio%201907">Como Calcio 1907</a>, where he ended his career in 2004.
International.
Padalino's only <a href="Italy%20national%20football%20team">international cap</a> came in 1996, in a friendly against <a href="Bosnia%20and%20Herzegovina%20national%20football%20team">Bosnia-Herzegovina</a>.
Coaching career.
Having retired in 2004, Padalino started as assistant coach to cousin <a href="Gian%20Piero%20Ventura">Gian Piero Ventura</a> at <a href="Hellas%20Verona">Hellas Verona</a>, leaving at the end of the season to rejoin first team Foggia, as its administrative secretary.
In 2007–08, Padalino rejoined Ventura as second coach, now in <a href="Pisa%20Calcio">Pisa Calcio</a>, also in the <a href="Serie%20B">second level</a>.
In 2009–10, Padalino started his career as head coach at <a href="A.S.G.%20Nocerina">Nocerina</a> in the <a href="Lega%20Pro%20Seconda%20Divisione">Seconda Divisione</a> until the end of the season.
On 7 August 2012 he was named new coach of <a href="A.C.D.%20Foggia%20Calcio">Foggia</a> in the <a href="Serie%20D">Serie D</a>. He led the team to promotion to Lega Pro in 2014, then he left the club.
In November 2014 he became the new manager of <a href="F.C.%20Grosseto%20S.S.D.">Grosseto</a>, in the Lega Pro, but he was fired in January 2015, before the end of the season.
On 5 October 2015 he was appointed new coach of <a href="Matera%20Calcio">Matera</a> and ended the season in 6th place in the Lega Pro.
On 13 June 2016 he was named new coach of <a href="U.S.%20Lecce">Lecce</a>, in the Lega Pro. He was sacked on 24 April 2017, with two games to spare.
He returned into management on 18 December 2018 after being appointed head coach of Foggia, in the <a href="Serie%20B">Serie B</a> league.
On 13 August 2020 he was hired by <a href="S.S.%20Juve%20Stabia">Juve Stabia</a>, freshly relegated into <a href="Serie%20C">Serie C</a>. He left the club at the end of the 2020–21 season.
On 29 December 2021, Padalino was appointed new head coach of Serie C club <a href="A.C.N.%20Siena%201904">Siena</a>.
